Reviews.Title: “1 of 2 worst-ever hotel experiences - DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: coyneone
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 rooms online using the Extend-A Suite website for a 1-night stay on 3/16. Upon our arrival, my family of 6 (including 2 teenage daughters) was assigned to 2 rooms that were in disastrous condition. There was food on the wall in one room, exposed nails sticking out of the wall in another, heavily stained mattresses and box springs, nonworking heat/air conditioning units, and strong smells of smoke and other odors. My family would not stay at the hotel and I asked the female manager on site to reverse the reservation, and she agreed. It was later explained to me that we were mistakenly shown rooms given to 'weekly' rental customers who naturally trash the rooms. Now, who would send a family to such rooms? I received a 'bill information printout' showing what I hoped was a reversal of the charges made to my credit card and assurances that I would not be charged, but sure enough the charges have shown up and I cannot get a reply from the hotel yet. I'm in for a battle just to get money back for 2 rooms that we NEVER USED.

Reviews.Title: “We ended up going to another hotel after one night..”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: The other reviewers are telling the truth, the hotel is currently "under renovation". However, it is no excuse for the room we had. We used the website to book our room. The photos shown are when the hotel was in it's "heyday". Not now. We checked in on 23-Jan-12. Expected Check out 29-Jan-12. Actual checkout: 24-Jan-12. The room that we had was supposed to be a "suite" with a full size fridge, stove top, and a microwave. The room they had for us was just a generic hotel room with none of the above amenities. We went to the front desk and asked for the room we were promised. The girl at the front said that housekeeping went home for the day and there was nothing they could do until tomorrow. We pushed that we needed a fridge (for medical reasons) and they relocated us to room 161. It was the same room, but more cramped with a microwave that was broken, (when you closed the door, it just started going, timer didn't work) a matress that was 1/2 off the bed, cigarette butts, wrappers and other debris around the bed. We were tired and just wanted to take a shower. I went in the bathroom and turned the light on, the vent fan was broken and nasty stuff was hanging out of it. I turned on the shower, then got in. The actual bathtub faucet was not secured in any way and 1/2 way through my shower, it shot off and nailed me in the shin! (I actually got a black and blue mark from it the size of a 1/2 dollar). We promptly checked out and went back to the other hotel that we stayed at. It was more expensive, but worth it. I might actually try the place again after a remodel, but they need to do A LOT of work. Other info: Excercise Room? Defunct. Business Center: Out of Date. 2 computers, both with 14" CRT screens. slow! Pool: OK, Shows it's age more than displayed picture Ballrooms: Currently under remodel, look OK with the new carpeting they were laying Attached Resturant: Was a Bennigans. Seen better days. Waitress was nice, food was WAY to salty. (And I L-O-V-E salt!)

Reviews.Title: “nice, friendly, great value!”
Reviews.Author: AndyL51
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Extend-@-Suites from 8 Dec thru 11 Dec. The hotel was being renovated but I found the staff friendly and my room was clean. I was able to get on the internet with no problem. Conference rooms were comfortable, not too cold, not too hot. and tables had poinsettas on them-nice touch. The restaurant opened during my stay-I ate there on the first night and the food was better than I expected for opening night. I very much appreciated the shuttle service to/from the airport. I highly recommend the Extend @ Suites for business and family travelers. Andy L

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Cassimax
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were very nice and the customer service was excellent. Hotel staff was friendly and very attentive. I liked the extra's that the hotel provided including free wifi and shuttle service to and from the airport. I would definitely stay here again if my travels bring me back to Indianapolis and would recommend it for both business and pleasure travelers.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: schuon1836
Reviews.Content: My group stayed here from 12/8/11 to 12/11/11. They have new management for the hotel as well as the restaurant "COOT". What a sexy name! A nice place to sit back, enjoy cold beer and watch the sport channels. Oh on weekend, they open up the dance floor for everyone. Yeah, booze, sport and dance; not to mention good foods. You can't go wrong with that. The owners are very friendly so are the people who work there. It can't get better than this in my opinion. For $49 or $59 per night, you get 4 star treatment. I highly recommend Extend @ Suite to anybody. -Sovanna

Reviews.Title: “Nice turnaround~!”
Reviews.Author: Scott D
Reviews.Content: This place was great! The staff was very friendly. They are doing renovations and it looks great! The conference rooms were comfortable, and the new owners are dedicated to making sure your stay is good!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnHemmis
Reviews.Content: 12/9/11 - Was here from DC for a three conference and had a great time on this property. Due to the numerous and spacious conference rooms we were able to have all of our events here. Thanks to the excellent home cooking from the restaurant and bar ("Coot's" named after someone's mother and uses her own recipes) we did not have to leave the facility which was great because of the outside temperature. One thing that really stood out was the friendly staff and owners who strived to make everyone feel at home. Great experience, outstanding value… I would highly recommend this full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay - 5 Star Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under new management and despite the incredible renovations going on, the rooms were very nice and at a great price. Brand new restaurant on site, pool & sauna, fitness center, free WIFI - the works. Looks like a fantastic place for events as 3 were held on site during my weekend stay and everyone I saw was loving this new hotel. What was most impressive was the hospitality! Staff was incredibly pleasant, helpful - even the laundry staff were conversational. Ever where I turned, they were asking me how my stay was and if there was anything else that I needed. Food in restaurant was great as well. If you are visiting Indianapolis, this is the place to stay...when renovations are fully completed, this hotel will be second to none. Outstanding Value and Service!!!
